mechanoreception.notes: As echinoderms, Ophiohelidae likely possess mechanoreceptors to detect physical stimuli in their environment, aiding in movement, feeding, and predator avoidance. Inferred from general echinoderm biology.

chemoreception.notes: Likely use chemoreceptors to detect chemical cues in the water, which is crucial for locating food sources and potential mates. Inferred from general echinoderm biology.

photoreception.notes: Presence and functionality of photoreceptors are unknown in this family. General echinoderms may have some light sensitivity.
